title: Kelly Rowland refuses to compare herself to men on The Today Show ahead of Royal Randwick in Sydney
text:
Kelly Rowland has revealed who she thinks is the greater gender as she reveals: 'Women are greater than men.'

Speaking on Nine's The Today Show live from her home in Hollywood, The Voice Australia judge said she refuses to compare herself to her male rivals.

She made the quip during an interview about her upcoming performance at Sydney's premiere race day, The Everest.

Famous face! The Voice Australia judge Kelly Rowland said this week she refused to compare herself to her male rivals. The former Destiny's Child singer said women 'rule the world'

Previous headliners at the glitzy event have included the likes of former One Direction heartthrob Liam Payne and singer Jason Derulo.

But Kelly made it clear she wasn't going to be drawn into competition with the male stars.

When asked how she planned to beat the previous performances, she said: 'I mean it's not about outdoing anybody as much as it is rising to my own occasion.'

Girl power! She revealed: 'I don't compare myself to a man at all. I think we're way greater than men.' Kelly made the quip during an interview about her upcoming performance at Sydney's premiere race day, The Everest

Incoming: The 38-year-old singer will hit the stage at the Royal Randwick Racecourse on October 19 to perform a medley of her hits, including When Love Takes Over and Work

The former Destiny's Child singer, who has built an army of Australian fans during her time on The Voice Australia, went on to say women 'rule the world'.

She revealed: 'I don't compare myself to a man at all. I think we're way greater than men.'

But Kelly admits that each performer's show is different and she's confident hers will wow racegoers later this month.

Pop royalty: Previous headliners at the glitzy event have included the likes of pop royalty Liam Payne (pictured) and Jason Derulo

'When you have fun it changes the atmosphere of everything,' she said.

'My show is different to Jason's show. Jason's show is different to anyone else's show.'

The 38-year-old singer will hit the stage at the Royal Randwick Racecourse on October 19 to perform a medley of her hits, including When Love Takes Over and Work.

Following in their footsteps: Kelly Rowland refused to compare herself to previous performers Jason Derulo (pictured) and Liam Payne
description: Kelly Rowland has revealed who she thinks is the greater gender as she reveals: 'Women are greater than men.'
authors: Jess Bell For Daily Mail Australia
